  • Real-time Analytics: Monitor stock movements and trends
  • Multi-platform Support: Web and mobile applications
  • Barcode Integration: Scan and manage products efficiently
  • Report Generation: Comprehensive reporting and exports
  • User Management: Role-based access control

docs.title: 🏗️ Architecture

  • Frontend: React web application with Material-UI
  • Mobile: Flutter mobile application
  • Database: Firebase Firestore for real-time data
  • Infrastructure: Docker containers with monitoring

docs.title: GET /products

docs.text:
• VALIDATION_ERROR: Input validation failed

  • UNAUTHORIZED: Authentication required
  • FORBIDDEN: Insufficient permissions
  • CONFLICT: Resource already exists

docs.title: Regras de Segurança Firestore
docs.text:
rules_version = '2';
service cloud.firestore {
  match /databases/{database}/documents {
    // Users podem ler/editar apenas seus próprios dados
    match /users/{userId} {
      allow read, write: if request.auth != null && request.auth.uid == userId;
      allow read: if request.auth != null && 
                     resource.data.role in ['admin', 'manager'];
    }

    // Products - baseado em permissões
    match /products/{productId} {
      allow read: if request.auth != null;
      allow write: if request.auth != null && 
                      hasPermission('products', 'write');
    }

    // Stock Movements - apenas utilizadores autorizados
    match /stockMovements/{movementId} {
      allow read: if request.auth != null;
      allow create: if request.auth != null && 
                       hasPermission('stock', 'write');
      allow update: if request.auth != null && 
                       (resource.data.createdBy == request.auth.uid ||
                        hasPermission('stock', 'admin'));
    }

    function hasPermission(resource, action) {
      return request.auth != null && 
             get(/databases/$(database)/documents/users/$(request.auth.uid))
             .data.permissions[resource][action] == true;
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Deployment Guide
docs.text: This guide covers deploying the Stock Management System to production environments.

docs.title: 🏗️ Deployment Architecture
docs.text:
The system supports multiple deployment strategies:

  1. Docker Containers (Recommended)
  2. Firebase Hosting (Frontend)
  3. Cloud Run (Backend Services)
  4. Traditional VPS/Dedicated Servers

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Docker Engine (>= 20.0)
  • Docker Compose (>= 2.0)
  • 4GB+ RAM
  • 20GB+ disk space

docs.title: Quick Deployment
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/org/stock-management.git
cd stock-management

  2. Configure environment: 

    cp infrastructure/.env.example infrastructure/.env
# Edit .env file with your configuration

  3. Deploy with Docker Compose: 

    cd infrastructure
docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up -d

docs.title: Production Docker Configuration
docs.text:
Create infrastructure/docker-compose.prod.yml:

version: '3.8'
services:
  # API Gateway
  api-gateway:
    image: stockmanagement/api-gateway:latest
    ports:
      - "80:8080"
      - "443:8443"
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=production
      - JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET}
    volumes:
      - ./ssl:/etc/ssl/certs
    depends_on:
      - products-service
      - stock-service

  # Products Service
  products-service:
    image: stockmanagement/products-service:latest
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=production
      - FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID=${FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID}
      - FIREBASE_PRIVATE_KEY=${FIREBASE_PRIVATE_KEY}
    scale: 2

  # Stock Service
  stock-service:
    image: stockmanagement/stock-service:latest
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=production
      - FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID=${FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID}
    scale: 2

  # Database
  postgres:
    image: postgres:15
    environment:
      - POSTGRES_DB=${POSTGRES_DB}
      - POSTGRES_USER=${POSTGRES_USER}
      - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=${POSTGRES_PASSWORD}
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
      - ./backups:/backups

  # Redis Cache
  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    volumes:
      - redis_data:/data

  # Monitoring
  grafana:
    image: grafana/grafana:latest
    ports:
      - "3001:3000"
    environment:
      - GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD=${GRAFANA_PASSWORD}
    volumes:
      - grafana_data:/var/lib/grafana

volumes:
  postgres_data:
  redis_data:
  grafana_data:

// Sensitive data encryption
import crypto from 'crypto';

const ENCRYPTION_KEY = process.env.ENCRYPTION_KEY; // 32 bytes key
const ALGORITHM = 'aes-256-gcm';

export function encrypt(text: string): string {
  const iv = crypto.randomBytes(16);
  const cipher = crypto.createCipher(ALGORITHM, ENCRYPTION_KEY);
  cipher.setAAD(Buffer.from('stock-management'));

  let encrypted = cipher.update(text, 'utf8', 'hex');
  encrypted += cipher.final('hex');

  const authTag = cipher.getAuthTag();

  return iv.toString('hex') + ':' + authTag.toString('hex') + ':' + encrypted;
}

export function decrypt(encryptedData: string): string {
  const parts = encryptedData.split(':');
  const iv = Buffer.from(parts[0], 'hex');
  const authTag = Buffer.from(parts[1], 'hex');
  const encrypted = parts[2];

  const decipher = crypto.createDecipher(ALGORITHM, ENCRYPTION_KEY);
  decipher.setAAD(Buffer.from('stock-management'));
  decipher.setAuthTag(authTag);

  let decrypted = decipher.update(encrypted, 'hex', 'utf8');
  decrypted += decipher.final('utf8');

  return decrypted;
}

docs.title: Error: npm install fails with permission errors
docs.text:
Problem: Permission denied when installing packages globally.

Solution: 

# Use npm's built-in solution
npm config set prefix ~/.local
export PATH=$PATH:~/.local/bin

# Or use a Node version manager
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash
nvm install 18
nvm use 18

docs.title: Error: ENOSPC: System limit for number of file watchers reached
docs.text:
Problem: Too many files being watched in development mode.

Solution: 

# Increase the limit
echo fs.inotify.max_user_watches=524288 | sudo tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf
sudo sysctl -p

docs.title: Error: Firebase project not found
docs.text:
Problem: Firebase project is not properly configured.

Solution: 

# Login to Firebase
firebase login

# List available projects
firebase projects:list

# Use specific project
firebase use your-project-id

# Verify configuration
cat .firebaserc

docs.title: Error: Permission denied when accessing Firestore
docs.text:
Problem: Firebase security rules are too restrictive.

Solution: 1. Check Firestore rules in Firebase Console 2. Update rules for development: 

rules_version = '2';
service cloud.firestore {
  match /databases/{database}/documents {
    match /{document=**} {
      allow read, write: if request.auth != null;
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Error: docker: permission denied
docs.text:
Problem: User doesn't have permission to run Docker commands.

Solution: 

# Add user to docker group
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

# Logout and login again, or run:
newgrp docker

docs.title: Error: Port already in use
docs.text:
Problem: Another service is using the required port.

Solution: 

# Find process using the port
sudo netstat -tulpn | grep :8080

# Kill the process
sudo kill -9 <process-id>

# Or use a different port
export PORT=8081

docs.title: Error: Cannot find module '../shared'
docs.text:
Problem: Shared library is not built or linked properly.

Solution: 

# Build shared library first
cd backend/shared
npm install
npm run build

# Install in other services
cd ../products
npm install ../shared

docs.title: Error: Firebase Admin SDK initialization failed
docs.text:
Problem: Firebase service account key is missing or invalid.

Solution: 1. Download service account key from Firebase Console 2. Set environment variable: 

export GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS=/path/to/service-account-key.json

docs.title: Error: Connection to database failed
docs.text:
Problem: Database is not running or connection string is incorrect.

Solution: 

# Check if PostgreSQL is running
sudo systemctl status postgresql

# Start PostgreSQL
sudo systemctl start postgresql

# Test connection
psql -h localhost -U username -d database_name

docs.title: Error: SSL connection required
docs.text:
Problem: Database requires SSL connection.

Solution: 

# Update connection string
DATABASE_URL="postgresql://user:password@host:5432/db?sslmode=require"

docs.title: Error: Module not found: Can't resolve '@/components'
docs.text:
Problem: Path aliases are not configured properly.

Solution: 1. Check tsconfig.json: 

{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "baseUrl": ".",
    "paths": {
      "@/*": ["src/*"]
    }
  }
}

  1. Check vite.config.ts: 
    import { defineConfig } from 'vite';
import path from 'path';

export default defineConfig({
  resolve: {
    alias: {
      '@': path.resolve(__dirname, './src'),
    },
  },
});

docs.title: Error: Network Error when calling APIs
docs.text:
Problem: CORS or proxy configuration issue.

Solution: 1. Update vite.config.ts: 

export default defineConfig({
  server: {
    proxy: {
      '/api': {
        target: 'http://localhost:8080',
        changeOrigin: true,
      },
    },
  },
});

docs.title: Error: Firebase Auth: Network request failed
docs.text:
Problem: Firebase configuration is incorrect or network issues.

Solution: 1. Check Firebase config: 

const firebaseConfig = {

  projectId: "your-project-id",

docs.text:
Problem: Health check endpoint is not responding.

Solution: 1. Check if the service is running: 

docker exec container-name ps aux

docs.title: Database Query Performance
docs.text:
Problem: Slow database queries.

Solution: 1. Add database indexes: 

CREATE INDEX idx_products_sku ON products(sku);
CREATE INDEX idx_stock_movements_product_id ON stock_movements(product_id);

  1. Optimize queries: 
    // Use pagination
const products = await db.products
  .limit(20)
  .offset(page * 20)
  .get();

// Use specific fields
const products = await db.products
  .select(['id', 'name', 'sku'])
  .get();

docs.title: Memory Leaks
docs.text:
Problem: Node.js process memory usage keeps growing.

Solution: 1. Monitor memory usage: 

# Install clinic.js
npm install -g clinic

# Profile memory
clinic bubbleprof -- node server.js

  1. Common fixes: 
    // Remove event listeners
process.removeListener('SIGINT', handler);

// Clear intervals
clearInterval(intervalId);

// Close database connections
await db.close();

docs.title: Slow Page Load Times
docs.text:
Problem: Large bundle size or unoptimized assets.

Solution: 1. Analyze bundle size: 

npm run build -- --analyze

  1. Implement code splitting: 
    // Lazy load components
const LazyComponent = lazy(() => import('./Component'));

// Use Suspense
<Suspense fallback={<Loading />}>
  <LazyComponent />
</Suspense>

docs.title: Error: JWT token expired
docs.text:
Problem: Token has expired and needs refresh.

Solution: 

// Implement token refresh
async function refreshToken() {
  try {
    const user = firebase.auth().currentUser;
    if (user) {
      const token = await user.getIdToken(true);
      // Update token in API client
      apiClient.setToken(token);
    }
  } catch (error) {
    // Redirect to login
    router.push('/login');
  }
}

docs.title: Error: Access to fetch blocked by CORS
docs.text:
Problem: Cross-origin requests are blocked.

Solution: 1. Configure CORS in backend: 

import cors from 'cors';

app.use(cors({
  origin: ['http://localhost:3000', 'https://yourdomain.com'],
  credentials: true,
}));

docs.title: Debug Information to Collect
docs.text:
When reporting issues, include:

  1. Environment Information: 

    # Node.js version
node --version

# npm version
npm --version

# OS information
uname -a

# Docker version (if using Docker)
docker --version

  2. Error Logs: 

    # Application logs
cat logs/app.log

# Docker logs
docker logs container-name

# System logs
journalctl -u service-name

  3. Configuration: 

    # Package versions
npm list

# Environment variables (without sensitive data)
env | grep -v SECRET | grep -v PASSWORD

docs.title: Fluxos de Utilizador - Sistema de Gestão de Stock
Visão Geral
docs.text: Este documento descreve os principais fluxos de utilizador do Sistema de Gestão de Stock, detalhando as interações esperadas para cada tipo de utilizador e funcionalidade.

docs.title: 1. Administrador
docs.text:
• Acesso total ao sistema
  • Gestão de utilizadores e configurações
  • Todos os relatórios e analytics

docs.title: 2. Gestor de Stock
docs.text:
• Gestão de produtos e fornecedores
  • Movimentos de stock
  • Relatórios operacionais

docs.title: 3. Operador
docs.text:
• Registo de movimentos de stock
  • Consulta de produtos
  • Relatórios básicos

docs.title: 1.1. Login do Utilizador
docs.text:
[Página de Login]
├── Inserir email/password
├── Opção "Lembrar-me"
├── Autenticação 2FA (opcional)
├── Redirecionamento para Dashboard
└── [Erro] → Mensagem de erro + tentar novamente

Passos Detalhados: 1. Utilizador acede à página de login 2. Insere credenciais (email + password) 3. Sistema valida credenciais via Firebase Auth 4. Se 2FA ativo, solicita código 5. Login bem-sucedido → Dashboard 6. Login falhado → Mensagem de erro
